oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Waterfall from a limestone spring
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clement, William L., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Spring originating from limestone rock formation recently identified by geologists as fault area that runs across the western edge of the county. Flow from spring increased following heavy rains - CA Hogan, SCS soil scientist, reaches for a cup of water. Spring is the source of water for household uses and livestock. Located three miles southwest of Woodbury.

One in a series of photographs of agricultural activities in Cannon County, TN that were taken by W.L. Clement, District Conservationist for the U.S. Soil Conservation Service, and his assistants between the mid-1940s and mid-1970s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photographs of W.L. Clement, U.S. Soil Conservation Service;
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Springs; Water supply
Photographic prints; Waterfalls
